ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] Mixer
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes, you can do that.  Since Reactor objects can have any number of inlets, a mixer is just a reactor with 2 inlets and one outlet. If you want to turn off

Yes, you can do that.  Since Reactor objects can have any number of  
inlets, a mixer is just a reactor with 2 inlets and one outlet. If you  
want to turn off chemistry in the mixer, use a reaction mechanism with  
no reactions for it. The 2 inlet streams can use different reaction  
mechanisms - species are matched by name.

I've posted 2 example Python scripts at  
http://blue.caltech.edu/cantera_dist/examples/python
The first (mix1.py) does a mixer with no chemistry, and the second one  
(mix2.py) adds an igniter to ignite the fuel/air mixture.

You're right, 'blue' was off the network for a while.  I couldn't  
figure out why it was not reachable over the network (and rebooted  
twice to try to cure it) until I happened to glance at the wall outlet  
and notice that one RJ45 cable was disconnected and was lying on the  
floor... I plugged it in, and suddenly 'blue' was cured.

By the way, if anyone (other than me) is interested, the SourceForge  
count for the number of downloads of Cantera is wrong.  It has  
incorrectly listed the number of downloads as zero for several days  
now.  This bug in their software is affecting other projects too, and  
they are working on it.

Also... I'm running behind schedule on releasing the new version with  
flames in Matlab. It's almost ready, but it will probably be next week  
before I release it.

Dave




On Thursday, May 29, 2003, at 07:28 AM, silvershadow112002 wrote:

>
> Hello,
>
> I'm looking into a way to pre-mix two different gases before putting
> them into a reactor.  For example, I want to use GRI and Air and mix
> them prior to sending them into a reactor.  What I'm looking for is a
> way to have Cantera (using Python) calculate the combined enthalpies,
> temperatures, etc. so that the data can be used in our research.  I'm
> fairly new to the system, so I'm not sure if a feature like this has
> been implemented yet or not.
>
> Also, I've been having trouble getting to the blue.caltech.edu site.
> Has it been down for a while, or is the problem on my end?
>
> Thank you for your time.
>
